review_text: Beautifully maintained apartment above the shed. The place has a homey hand-built feel and is much larger than I was expecting! The shed is located right on the edge of a pristine woodland that I assume is loaded with deer and other wildlife. If there hadn't been a snowstorm that weekend I would love to have spent lots of time walking around in the forest. Carolyn and Herb were friendly and good communicators that respected my privacy during my stay. I was a little surprised that there was no TV in such a complete apartment, but that actually worked well for my purposes this trip. There are puzzles and games and it would be a terrific retreat for a young family. Thank you for the great stay!

The place was exceptionally clean, was exactly as described and included some unexpected bonuses such as a large snack basket, some beer and wine, half and half for our coffee, cereal and milk for breakfast along with a super bright flashlight and an umbrella. The entire place was decorated very nicely and included some small but important features like a hook right outside the shower for your towel and a nicely organized book with restaurant and attraction options. The view out the family room window is awesome and you feel like you are in the middle of the woods. This is a very secluded place in the country but close to downtown Menomonie and the Red Cedar bike trail. If you're looking for a place to relax and enjoy the local area at a fair price this is the place to stay. You won't be disappointed.

review_text:
The studio apartment offered by Chris and Theresa was absolutely lovely. It was immaculately clean, very spacious, beautifully decorated and equipped with everything you could possibly need, as well as the very thoughtful extra touches that made our stay exceptional. There was a special welcoming gift waiting for my husband and me (we were celebrating our anniversary), a very well stocked kitchen with snacks and breakfast items provided, a fabulous king sized bed with skylights overhead and a charming deck with two chairs - just right for our morning tea and coffee amidst the colorful trees.
This wonderful studio is very private, as it is above their extra large detached garage. It also has its own entrance which does not go through the garage, and parking is very convenient.
We had scenic views of the countryside and woods from the many windows, skylights and deck that this apartment offered.
We highly recommend our hosts, Chris and Theresa, as well as their amazing studio apartment to anyone visiting this part of Wisconsin. We truly hope to return some time soon.

review_text: The earth-sheltered â€œHobbitâ€ home is in a beautifully landscaped setting amid the very picturesque Wisconsin farm country of my youth. Quiet and spacious accommodations in a wonderfully relaxed atmosphere were the perfect retreat for me from a crowded family reunion location. Barb and Don are kind and thoughtful hosts, and wonderful conversationalists. Barbâ€™s coffee cake is to die for(!!) and not to be missed. The bed was very comfortable with what felt like a new mattress, and made up with silky, high thread count sheets. Everything was spotless yet unfussy and comfortingly homey. I was made to feel right at home myself, too. Welcomed to come and go as I wished and I only wish Iâ€™d had more time to explore the lovely, flower-filled yard. The vaulted ceiling architecture and enormous dimensions of the kitchen and entryway provided ample ventilation for our times. Fluffy towels and plenty of them, a space for hanging clothes in their own closet, and ample surfaces for luggage made it very easy to quickly unpack and have all my things easy to findâ€”no need to live from my suitcases. Such clean, comfortable and quiet accommodations at such a reasonable price beat any hotel. I wonâ€™t hesitate to stay here again should the opportunity present itself!

review_text:
Barb & Don's Hobbit Home is wonderful. Everything was as nice (or nicer!) than a luxury hotell, scrupulously clean, delightfully decorated, and very welcoming.
This is a private room with a cute little loft space and a bath across the hall, in a separate hallway from the owner's own bed & bath space. The bed was amazingly comfortable, the bathroom full of clean towels and cozy warmth.
We were made to feel very welcome in the living/dining/kitchen/entry area. We arrived quite late in the evening, and the hosts left us a homemade breakfast in the morning.
The highway is quite close but traffic was minimal during the night and it didn't disturb us at all. The cell service is quite weak inside the house, but Barb & Don gave us the wifi password. (We had trouble with the wifi, but I'm confident they would have been able to fix it for us had we asked before we went to bed!)
Our preference is for entirely separate spaces, and yet we fully intend to stay at the Hobbit Home again if we get the chance!

review_text: What a truly special space. Came here with my girlfriends for a birthday weekend getaway and wow were we blown away. To start, the view of the lake is absolutely beautiful. We spent almost an entire day sitting on the deck and admiring the view in the sunshine. The cabin itself is lovely, spacious, and welcoming. We watched plenty of movies cuddled up on the couches at night. Plenty of bed and couch space for larger groups (we only had 4). The fire pit area is lovely and there is plenty of extra wood to split if you do not bring your own. The neighbors are extremely nice and there were a few extremely sweet neighborhood dogs that hung around and said hello. Menomonie is about a 10 minute drive for anything you need during your stay, and the place is well-stocked with soap, laundry detergent, cleaning products, etc etc. One of my friends even took one of the kayaks out on the lake for a while! Overall, a very welcoming space with amazing energy and at an extremely reasonable price. Everything was wonderful.

review_text:
Gregâ€™s place is great! Wonderful cabin-feel to it. Sits high in Lake Tainter with great views of the lake. Heads up that the lake turns pretty green for about two months in the late summer (some locals told me), and our end of the lake had a pretty strong smell to it. But, it wouldnâ€™t stop us from visiting again! The fishing was good, as the green layer only goes down an inch or two - below that is clear for the fish to see bait. If you enjoy fishing, be sure to hit up Bait On Broadway in Menomonie (about ten minutes away). Great bait shop with super cool owners - who know all the good spots and were very hospitable!
Gregs place had everything we needed. Stocked bathrooms, kitchen, Netflix, a beautiful deck. We loved it!

Due to the proximity to lake, always expect flies and small bugs around the place so remember to keep the deck door closed as much as possible. The lake is ~70 steps down from the deck, just FYI :) The sunset over the lake was breathtaking as well as the Fall colors in the area. I would love to come back next time.

There were many beds, allowing for any combination of sleeping arrangements. His place is only 15 min or less to Menominee and very close to the local bar. I would absolutely recommend his place to stay!

review_text: We stayed in Greg's cabin during a visit to family over the holidays, and it was the perfect home base for our vacation. Since I had not visited in the winter for several years (and my sons never had), I was concerned about the cold--Greg made sure the heat was on and ready for us when we checked in, and also sent a message halfway through our stay to make sure everything was going well. The cabin was well appointed and very comfortable for our family of 5. It's a nice quiet spot, and the view of the lake from the house was lovely--it was too cold to do much outside (for us Texans, anyway), so we appreciated the board games and books when we were relaxing between visits to various relatives. I'm sure it's even better in the summer!

My two day 'retreat' at Third Mountain was ideal to find focus from my busy Twin Cities urban life. I needed to work remotely, think and write and have strong WiFi for client calls. The Farmhouse - dining room table, salon and even the kitchen table - provided amazing support for this new creative energy. Nature, including green spaces and bird song, drew a literal landscape of relaxation and centeredness. And I slept great, which rarely happens.
Host Andrea created a wonderful home-away-from-home, within an hour's drive of St. Paul. She was very responsive to all my questions so I had the supplies I needed to have a productive professional 'retreat. I can't wait to return this summer!

review_text: This is an ideal spot for a visit when in Menomonie. Besides having everything you need in the space, the surroundings are full of charm. The 1 bedroom cottage has a full kitchen, dining table, comfy living room with tv and fireplace, 3/4 bath and comfy queen bed in a separate bedroom. The large bedroom window is a great view of a horse and two donkeys who provide a charming natural alarm in the morning. The front room window overlooks the beautiful red barns, the chickens and if you look closely you can see a few cats. Everything is beautifully cared for and decorated for the season. Checkin was easy and Clint is available to answer any questions or resolve any issues. We initiated and enjoyed a morning chat to learn more about his spot and to meet his youngest daughter. All in all the two day stay was perfect and highly recommended.

This airbnb home was perfect for us. It had everything we needed , including a washer and dryer and an electric fire place. The location is idyllic on top of a hill on the property of the cutest Wisconsin farm surrounded by horses, donkeys, dogs and cattle and within the city limits.
It was very clean and had excellent air quality. The mattress was on the softer side, but it appeared that one could remove the topper to have it firmer.
Plenty of drawer space was an extra bonus.
The refrigerator was stocked full of amenities, fresh fruit and breakfast items and our host was quick to respond to anything we needed extra.
We certainly will return.
Thank you!

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Where to start? We are already trying to find excuses to go back to Menomonie again just so we can stay with Clint and Nora! From the minute Clint met us at the door to our place with shovel in hand (they were getting another 6" of snow when we arrived!) to the treats left for us in the fridge, we felt so at home in the guest house. It was warm, cozy, and so very clean. The bed was extremely comfortable and the whole house just felt like home away from home. The location was perfect for us (close to our event in town) but still gave you that feeling that you were well out into the country surrounded by beautiful farmland. Even the family dogs were there to greet us and say goodbye as we came and went from our place. Clint was also very responsive to all of our questions and even though we were pretty self-sufficient, I felt assured that Clint and Nora would have been there for us. We have stayed at many BnB properties, and this one ranks right up at the top for us.

name: Sandy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·

,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Exceeded our expectations.
The cabin is charming, cozy, clean, and comfortable. It is built right on the waters edge. The wrap around deck offers beautiful views of the bay on Tainter Lake. Feels like a private retreat.
The dock was in great condition with Adirondack chairs to sit, relax and enjoy the peaceful view. A bonus - we threw in fishing lines and caught bass right off the dock.
The lake was very quiet - aka peaceful. Caveat, we stayed in September, not the summer months.
The beds were both very comfortable which is very important to us. There was a view of the lake from the master bedroom looking out sliding glass doors. Bonus!
The kitchen is large with everything (cooking utensils) you would need to cook if you choose to do so.
They have a game cabinet in the living room filled with a wide variety of games. We spent the evening playing games we had not played in many years. It was wonderful.

The cabin is very nicely decorated with lots of kitschy Wisconsin touches. You can sit on the deck and watch birds in the massive tree that overhangs the porch. Jake's Supper Club is a great nearby option for dinner. Robb is a lovely host and even though he lives on the property in the main house up above, you still feel like you have lots of privacy. When were surprised to get homemade cookies, fresh sourdough bread, and a bottle of local wine when we arrived. Highly recommend. We will definitely be back. It will be a super cozy place to stay in the winter.

review_text:
Needs a handyman......
Looks good on the surface but things need to be addressed. 2 stove burners didn't work, most of the wooden stools are coming apart and 1 we didn't trust to sit on. 1 kitchen blind was broken and 1 missing a panel. Grill had mold growing inside..eewww and the hot tub needs to be cleaned, maybe water changed. It gave off a scent of sunscreen and sweat. Biggest let down was the jacuzzi tub not working, maybe we missed that note somewhere. Oh, and sitting on the couch made my allergies go nuts. I was fine everywhere else, just not on the couch. If you plan on using the Keurig you'd better like French Roast and only that. And that occasional knocking sound? I think it's a Pex water line in the ceiling that's not secured so it bangs against the sheetrock.
It's a cure little place but it's gotten some water and tear. Maybe the group before us was partying hard, maybe the caretaker isn't paying close attention. A for concept, C- for execution.

The apartment above the garage was as well appointed as the rest of the place, including a kitchenette, bathroom with shower, and tv! Just make sure to note that it is not connected to the rest of the cabin- just a couple steps outside, which is really no big deal, unless you donâ€™t like being alone/separated! It did end up being a little chilly in there, and when we asked about the thermostat the property caretaker popped over within an hour to check it out and bring a space heater, just in case. It was a great stay and we highly recommend this place for a cozy winter weekend, or longer!

I enjoyed a morning cup of coffee at the kitchen table while a sweet little deer just outside the patio doors and I stared each other down - how special!! Heidi went above and beyond hosting our visit and made sure we had everything we could ever ask for - and more!! From spotlessly clean everything - to those SO-appreciated touches like shampoo, conditioner, shower gel - - and more!!. You will not regret one moment of time spent here - whether you have a busy schedule planned, or like us - you just wanted to reconnect and enjoy each other in beautiful surroundings!!

Heidiâ€™s directions to the getaway were spot on and The Luxe Chalet was brimming withTLC! Full of thoughtful, beautiful appointments, their home is well furnished with every little thing you might need. We took full advantage of the luxurious hot tub and decided to sleep in the upper loft so we could talk late into the morning hours, each in our own comfy bed. There is plenty of spaces for quiet conversationsâ€¦it was difficult to decide where to sitâ€¦fire pitâ€¦porchâ€¦hot tubâ€¦hammockâ€¦or just lounge in the living room listening to music. The large dining room table was utilized to do some creating together, but I can imagine dinners full of laughter as well. A fully equipped kitchen offered the ability to have morning coffee while watching the river laze itâ€™s way by us and then make breakfast using up to date fixtures. We loved how even the laundry was made adorable as the chirping machines informed us their cycles were complete.
Last, but not least, be sure to check out their recommendations from cafes to supper club â€¦ if you can bear to tear yourself away from the space; that is.
We are already planning to return to enjoy fall colors, heated floors and a roaring fireplace! Thank you Super Hosts, Heidi and Tom, we are blessed you decided to share your home. We recommend this property to those needing cozy gatherings and romantic getaways. And do it soon before the owners decide THEY should take full advantage of this gem for themselves!

review_text:
The house is smaller, but it is super cute. The stairs down to the hot tub we're very steep, but manageable for my wife and I who are in our 40s. I would be concerned for anyone with mobility issues getting up and down those stairs. The hot tub was totally worth climbing down the stairs though!
The kitchen was stocked with everything you need to cook food and a nice bonus was that there was a Keurig with plenty of pods available for use.
We were able to log in and watch a movie on the TV in the living room, it was a nice touch that we didn't have to sign into any of our own accounts to watch.
Eating in the dining room with the windows right over the lake made it feel like we were on a houseboat.
Overall, this was a very good experience and we will definitely try to make it back in the future. This is one of the best airbnbs we've ever stayed in.

review_text: We were a group of four ladies on a weekend girls trip plus one dog. The cabin was cozy and exactly what we were looking for in a relaxing getaway. The building is right on the lake/river and sitting on the dock was so peaceful! We did not get a chance to try the fire pit out, even though the weather was perfect for it. The kitchen had all the cooking utensils, so you only need to bring food. The place had been cleaned thoroughly before check-in and the hot-tub was prepped for us! Jake's Supper Club is very close and a recommend from our group for lovely dinner out. The four of us were able to manage the space just fine, but felt this location is ideal for 3 people. The stairs have a bit of a tight turn on them to get up to the bedrooms. If your dog is like mine and hates stairs and vinyl plank floors, plan on them hanging out on the main level for your stay. Heidi is a great host. Very friendly and responsive. We would consider staying here again!

Especially the ones going down to the lower level where you go out to the dock and where the hot tub is, his main perks of picking this place were for fishing and the hot tub. Photos do not show how steep these steps are. I even messaged about how far it was to fish due to us getting up there in age. Nothing was mentioned about the steps that go to the level to get to the dock. I am in pretty good physical shape and even I had issues with them. I see in other reviews that the house was not clean. name: Matthew
rating_info:

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This cabin was a delightful get-away. I needed a quiet place to sit, look at the water, and read a book, and this was the perfect place to do it. The cabin has a funky layout and good character, but this does not distract from the home-like charm. So many places have a sterile, hotel-like blandness to them, but this cabin retains a better character. I found lounging on the couch, sitting on the dock, soaking in the hot tub, and even lingering in bed, to all be incredibly cozy and relaxing. Situated right on the water, the dock is a great place to sit.
In late summer/autumn, the algal blooms in the lake are pretty intense, so no getting in the water. There are a couple of great places to eat an easy walk or short drive away (Jake's Supper Club and Pioneer Grill and Saloon) - the walleye was insanely delicious. Menomonie was a brief drive away for additional food, supply, and entertainment/diversion options.
Heidi was an incredible host. She was incredibly communicative and responsive. Her husband was willing to make the drive to help me out when I had some difficulties, although thankfully I did not end up needing them to put themselves out.
I am so grateful to have stumbled on their listing and to have worked out the opportunity to stay for my little retreat. I sincerely hope I get to again.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This house is too dang cute. It has an interesting layout with a boathouse feel and I was into it! The photos are accurate to the look. I wish we had more time to enjoy the outdoor seating area but the weather was questionable, so we just spent every night in the hot tub (awww - lol). The bed we slept in was comfortable which doesn't always happen at an airbnb. The wifi was fast which is important if your working from here. The location was near Red Cedar State Trail only a few minutes (drive or bike) away which also happens to be next to a brewery with yummy pizza (recommended by Heidi). You're also only an hour from Minneapolis - worth the drive to Minnehaha Falls Park. Heidi was stellar to work with - answered all the questions, gave local tips (fun supper club in walking distance), and made some adjustments to accommodate us which we appreciated greatly. Would recommend and come back again.

Â·
Stayed about a week
review_text: We loved Heidi's home. The location on the river to the lake was perfect, and the deck right on the water was in constant use by us during our weeks stay, as was the hot tub conveniently located in the boat house area right on the lake too. The area was super quiet, and we barely saw anyone else the whole time we were there, except for the boats going by. It was the perfect space to unwind, and we will surely be back at some point in the future. Well appointed kitchen, amazing fast WiFi, and cable TV. Highly recommended, although be aware that as described the stairs are very steep to the basement/dock area (pretty much a ladder), and the outside walkway down to the dock is very uneven with no handrail, but that certainly didn't detract from our amazing experience. Heidi was super responsive to all our questions as well.
